intro: Geniostoma insulare, commonly known as the island geniostoma, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and often have a hairy texture.
